Uses of Interface
importance.ImportanceIF

  • Packages that use ImportanceIF 
    Package Description
    importance.external  
    importance.external.permutation  
    importance.internal  

    • Uses of ImportanceIF in importance.external

      Subinterfaces of ImportanceIF in importance.external 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      interface  ExternalImportanceIF<E>
      This interface must be implemented in order to define objects that will compute the importance of variables after the forest is grown, from a criterion independent of the forest induction.

    • Uses of ImportanceIF in importance.external.permutation

      Classes in importance.external.permutation that implement ImportanceIF 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Average
      Given a scalar statistic, computes the average statistic for each variable over all trees
      class  ChisqOnTwoConfusionTables
      Given a contingency table, computes a chi^2 test on the sum over all trees of the contingency tables for each variable.
      class  KSTestOnTreePredPerfs
      Given two predictive performances for each tree - one for the original OOB and one with a permuted OOB - computes a KS test for each variable.
      class  PermImportance<E,I>
      This class defines feature importance as a comparison between two statistics extracted from the decision trees and their corresponding OOB (e.g. the predictive performance of a tree on its OOB).

    • Uses of ImportanceIF in importance.internal

      Subinterfaces of ImportanceIF in importance.internal 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      interface  InternalImportanceIF
      This interface must be implemented in order to define objects that will aggregate importance of node splits in a forest (splitting index)
      Classes in importance.internal that implement ImportanceIF 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  AverageSplitIndex
      Aggregation of the internal (split) importance of a forest using a mean.
      class  VariableCount
      Aggregation of the internal (split) importance of a forest using a sum of occurrence.
